sections.comments: Credits will be granted for only one of FNIS 100, FNSP 100, or FNSP 200.  This course is intended for undergraduate students only. If you are a graduate student, please visit: http://fnis.arts.ubc.ca/graduate-courses/. This course is now full, please register in the waitlist section FNIS 100 WL1.

This is a waitlist section for undergraduate students  - only register in this section if FNIS 100 001 is full. Registering in the waitlist section does not guarantee you a spot in the course. When spots open up you will be moved from this section to the actual course. Email cis.program@ubc.ca with any questions.

description: The historical, cultural, political, economic and legal issues that inform the experiences of Indigenous peoples in Canada, examined from both Indigenous and non-Indigenous perspectives. Credit will be granted for only one of FNIS 100, FNSP 100, or FNSP 200.
